Package net.objectzoo.ebc.join

This package contains some ready to use Join EBCs as well as base classes that can be used to implement own specialized Join subclasses.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    JoinOutputCreator<Input1,Input2,Output>
    This interface describes objects capable of creating output for Joins.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CollectionsOutputCreator<Input1Element,Input2Element,OutputElement>
    This JoinOutputCreator implementation takes two input Collections and creates an output List with one output value for every pair of values in the input collections.
    ConstructableOutputCreator<Input1,Input2,Output>
    This JoinOutputCreator implementation creates the output by dynamically invoking the given Constructor.
    GenericJoin<Input1,Input2,Output>
    This Join base class joins two input values to an output value that has a constructor taking the two input values as parameters.
    GenericJoinCollections<Input1Element,Input2Element,OutputElement>
    This Join base class joins two input collections of the input element types to a collection of the output element type by using a constructor of the output element type taking the two input element type values as parameters.
    GenericJoinObjectAndCollection<Input1,Input2Element,OutputElement>
    This Join base class joins a single first input value with a second collection of input elements to a collection of output element by using a constructor of the output element type taking the first input type and the second input element type value as parameters.
    Join<Input1,Input2,Output>
    This is a class that can be used to implement Join EBCs.
    JoinBase<Input1,Input2,Output>
    This is a base class that can be extended to easily implement custom Joins.
    JoinCollections<Input1Element,Input2Element,OutputElement>
    This Join class joins two input collections of the input element types to a collection of the output element type by using a JoinOutputCreator to join the input element types to the output element type.
    JoinInputStorage<Input1,Input2>
    This class defines a storage that is used by Join implementations to store their input values.
    JoinObjectAndCollection<Input1,Input2Element,OutputElement>
    This Join class joins a single first input value with a second collection of input elements to a collection of output element by using a JoinOutputCreator to join the first input type and the second input element type to the output element type.
    JoinProcessAndSignal<T>
    This is a special flow EBC implementation that joins together a process and a signal flow and thus implements the interfaces ProcessAndResultFlow and StartAndResultFlow.
    JoinSignals
    This is a special flow EBC implementation that joins together two signal flows.
    JoinToPair<Input1,Input2>
    This is a Join implementation that joins the two input values to a Pair.
    ObjectAndCollectionOutputCreator<Input1,Input2Element,OutputElement>
    This JoinOutputCreator implementation takes a first input and a Collection of input elements and creates a List of output elements that contains an output element for each element present in the second input constructed together with the given first input.
    PairOutputCreator<Input1,Input2>
    This JoinOutputCreator implementation crates Pair instances as output values.

Package net.objectzoo.ebc.join Description

This package contains some ready to use Join EBCs as well as base classes that can be used to implement own specialized Join subclasses.
